Subject: Output a list of domain names rather than HTML documents ?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=414420830; y=3CMd-FpeQPCYvvq0F38gJu8veME5cWMbWr767L0zj-V3zxqPCvX5LR3yU1Y8gqFfbzhp4pmw

I would like to design a crawl that takes a number of seed domains, and ret=
urns a list of URLS (domains) that are found from those seed domains matchi=
ng a certain processing criteria. I do not need to have the html content of=
 the matched domains saved for subsequent use.

The criteria I want to test=
 against are: 

The presence of a certain page on each site found from the =
seed sites, ie /about-us.html or /privacypolicy.html

The presence of a cer=
tain substring within the urls of the anchors on the index page, ie "?actio=
n=3Dcontactus" 

If any of the criteria are met, I would like the domain ad=
ded to my output list. 

Does this sound like a job suitable for this crawl=
er to execute? Is there another way to think about the problem that would b=
e more appropriate for the tool? Basically I'm trying to get a list of doma=
ins that are running a certain script in order to contact them for requesti=
ng link exchanges.
